name: df-cid
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6, setvar s7
body: |- wceq(ccid, cmpt(s0, ccat, csb(s1, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), csb(s2, cfv(chom, cv(s0)), csb(s3, cfv(cco, cv(s0)), cmpt(s4, cv(s1), crio(s5, co(cv(s4), cv(s2), cv(s4)), wral(s6, cv(s1), wa(wral(s7, co(cv(s6), cv(s2), cv(s4)), wceq(co(cv(s5), co(cop(cv(s6), cv(s4)), cv(s3), cv(s4)), cv(s7)), cv(s7))), wral(s7, co(cv(s4), cv(s2), cv(s6)), wceq(co(cv(s7), co(cop(cv(s4), cv(s4)), cv(s3), cv(s6)), cv(s5)), cv(s7))))))))))))
comment: Define the category identity arrow. Since it is uniquely defined when it exists, we do not need to add it to the data of the category, and instead extract it by uniqueness. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Jan-2017.)
